trans-unit.source: Specifies security property requirements specific to the listener service in the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF).
Token requirement classes are used by a security token manager to specify what is required of a security token, such as the key size, key type, and how the key can be used.
When a security token can be identified that matches the specified criteria, a security token provider and security token authenticator can be created.
This token requirement class specifies recipient-related requirements.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.RecipientServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement.SupportSecurityContextCancellationProperty%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement.IsInitiatorProperty%2A> properties are set to `false`.
Gets or sets the audit log location.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation> is an enumeration with the following members:
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Application>: The application log in the operating system Event Log.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Default>: The default location, which is determined by the operating system.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Security>: The security log in the event log.
The audit log location.
Gets or sets the listener URI.
The listener URI.
Gets or sets the message authentication audit level.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel> is an enumeration with the following members:
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.Failure>: Only failed security-related events are recorded.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.None>: No events are recorded.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.Success>: Only successful security-related events are recorded.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.SuccessOrFailure>: Both failed and successful security-related events are recorded.
The audit level of the message authentication.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the audit failures are suppressed.
`true` if the audit failures are suppressed; otherwise, `false`.
Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.
This method displays the property type name, and for each property, the property name and value.
A text representation of this instance of the class.
